page.title: 01ADLINGTON AND MOTTRAM
page.content: Our survey area is comprised of land west of the Pennine foothills. Most of the area is grazing land for dairy cattle and horses.Two rivers, the Bollin and the Dean, flow from the hills to the east, through the area, towards the coast. To the north lie Poynton and Stockport, to the west Wilmslow and Alderley Edge, to the south Macclesfield and to the south-east Bollington. The two villages of Adlington and Mottram are similar in both having no real centre and having many large detached residential properties.In both communities people travel to the surrounding towns and even further afield for employment.Though there is a flow of people moving in and out of the area the total population remains constant and there is little building.
